intro: Campanula woronowii, commonly known as the Woronow's bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its blue to violet bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Campanula woronowii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
